result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Applicable costs, fees and surcharges including DNA to be paid by 8/6/2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamari Lamar Lloyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 4 days in the House of Correction, with 4 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) to be paid by 08/06/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Letters in Support of the Defendant;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, court enters a plea of not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(3g)(e), a Unclassified Misdemeanor.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are close to a resolution and request to vacate the jury trial scheduled for 7/22/15 and calendar a future date for plea/sentencing.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  David John Behm for Marissa Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 15.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. CAse calendared for SCHEDULING on 5/8/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

CORRECTION TO ENTRY OF APRIL 6, 2015.
Defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ron Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  State is requesting an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ron Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  State is requesting an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond that was previously signed to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jamari Lamar Lloyd
Current: 6402 North 107th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 03-27-2015)
Prior: 6402 North 107th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224

Defendant Jamari Lamar Lloyd in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel's Motion to DISMISS the criminal complaint was DENIED by the Court.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-27-2015 at 1:30pm
